index.html
RMarkdown for Scientists 1 About this

RMarkdown for Scientists Nicholas Tierney 2018-11-06 1 About this This is a 3 hour workshop initially designed for the SSA Vic and MIG meeting on November 13, 2018. After completing this course, you will know how to: Create your own R Markdown document Create figures and tables that you can reference in text, and update with - your data Export your R Markdown document to PDF, HTML, and Microsoft Word Use keyboard shortcuts to improve workflow Cite research articles and generate a bibliography We may, depending on time, also cover the following areas: Change the size and type of your figures Create captions for your figures, and reference them in text Cite research articles and generate a bibliography Debug and handle common errors
